meanings.definition: A clasping or gripping of hands as a greeting or sign of agreement.
meanings.sent1: The friends exchanged a warm handclasp when they met.
meanings.sent2: The handclasp between the two leaders sealed the deal.
meanings.sent3: The handclasp between the rivals was surprisingly firm.
meanings.sent4: The handclasp of friendship bridged the gap between them.
meanings.sent5: The firm handclasp left a lasting impression on him.

meanings.definition: To clasp or grip hands together.
meanings.sent1: They handclasped to show their unity.
meanings.sent2: She handclasped her hands tightly in anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The children handclasp in excitement before the game.
meanings.sent4: He handclasped her hand gently, showing his affection.
meanings.sent5: The team handclasped before the match for good luck.
